32.title: The Plugin: Your First ExpressionEngine Add-On
32.shortDescription: Writing an ExpressionEngine Add-On can be daunting. But the Plugin is a no-nonsense, easy place to start.
32.longDescription: Writing an ExpressionEngine Add-On can be daunting. But the Plugin is a no-nonsense, easy place to start.

31.title: Cache-Busting CSS and JavaScript in ExpressionEngine
31.shortDescription: Far-future cache headers are important, sure, but how do you bust the cache in ExpressionEngine when an asset changes?
31.longDescription: Far-future cache headers are important for the performance of a site. But they also require the the ability to bust the cache when an asset changes. But how do you do that in ExpressionEngine?

30.title: Introducing Max Length
30.shortDescription: Max Length is an accessory that provides a small, unobtrusive indicator for how many characters an input has left before reaching its maximum length.
30.longDescription: Max Length is an accessory that provides a small, unobtrusive indicator for how many characters an input has left before reaching its maximum length.

29.title: On Development Decisions
29.shortDescription: Black and white. Good and bad. The right way and the wrong way. It would be great if web development fell into nice neat little categories. It doesn't.
29.longDescription: Black and white. Good and bad. The right way and the wrong way. It would be great if web development fell into nice neat little categories. It doesn't.

28.title: Squashing Commits
28.shortDescription: Your git history can read like a rambling stream-of-consciousness tome or a sharp-witted novella. Do us all a favor and squash your commits.
28.longDescription: Your git history is like a book. It can read like a rambling stream-of-consciousness tome. Or you can squash your commits to read like a sharp-witted novella. Do us all a favor and squash your commits.

27.title: Release Cycles
27.shortDescription: Changes on the web are instantaneous. Changes to an iPhone app are not. How that difference affects the design of an app.
27.longDescription: I work on the internet, where I mostly build and maintain websites. Changes on the web are instantaneous. But recently, I worked on an iPhone app where this isn't the case. And it got me thinking about release cycles and their impact.

26.title: Oops I created a Spambot
26.shortDescription: "Build it and they will come" doesn't work on the internet, but Twitter provided a world of opportunity for its5.info.
26.longDescription: "Build it and they will come" doesn't work on the internet. its5.info needed a strategy. There were several options I knew wouldn't work. But Twitter provided a world of opportunity.

25.title: Why I Built It: its5.info
25.shortDescription: It's 5 o'clock somewhere, they say. But where? The story of why I built its5.info
25.longDescription: On a cold day in late March, 2014, someone just trotted out the old phrase, "It's 5 o'clock somewhere," and I immediately wondered where? That's when I had the idea to build a website that tells me where in the world it's 5 pm.
